english_translation: Narrated by Kurayb ibn Fatik: He came to the Prophet ﷺ, and the Prophet ﷺ said to him: "O Kurayb, if it were not for two flaws in you, you would be the man!" He said: "What are they, by my father and mother? One would suffice me." The Prophet ﷺ said: "You let your hair grow long, and you drag your lower garment." So he cut his hair and raised his garment. His son Ayman ibn Kurayb was a poet, horseman, and noble person.

english_translation: The name of al-Azwar is Malik ibn Aws ibn Judhaimah ibn Rabi'ah ibn Malik ibn Malik ibn Tha'labah ibn Dudan ibn Asad ibn Khuzaymah. He was a horseman and accepted Islam. He narrated from the Prophet ﷺ the hadith of al-Laquuh: 'Leave the call of milk.' Darar ibn al-Azwar fought on the day of al-Yamama with the fiercest fighting until both his legs were cut off completely. Then he crawled on his knees while fighting, and the horses trampled him, until death overcame him. Muhammad ibn Umar said: Darar ibn al-Azwar remained wounded at al-Yamama before Khalid ibn al-Walid departed by one day, then he died. He had recited his poem which began with the letter Meem. Muhammad ibn Umar said: This is more confirmed to us than other [versions].
